chapter.title: Backlog
chapter.p: Program backlogs allow you to manage all the potential and upcoming work in your program. By using the program backlog you can capture high-level objectives that represent value and will be delivered as part of your program.

The backlog supports prioritization of your objectives based on relative value and size. Using the backlog in combination with a plan, which is a part of every program, you can quickly move from prioritizing objectives to planning them across projects.
When developing the backlog as one of the central workspaces within the Mingle Program, we wanted to give you the ability to:

item.strong: Keep your program backlog lean and execute work in small batches
Focus on customer value by articulating problems, not implementing solutions
Analyze work on a just-in-time basis

chapter.p: We used these principles to inform the design of the backlog and its supporting actions: capturing and prioritizing objectives, planning and sharing them with your team, and pruning your backlog.
